label: ham
subject: Re: [R] Textpad help
body: 82 (return) [ Ammian. xvii. 8. Zosimus, l. iii. p. 146-150, (his narrative is darkened by a mixture of fable,) and Julian. ad S. P. Q. Athen. p. 280. His expression. This difference of treatment confirms the opinion that the Salian Franks were permitted to retain the settlements in Toxandria. Note: A newly discovered fragment of Eunapius, whom Zosimus probably transcribed, illustrates this transaction. ÒJulian commanded the Romans to abstain from all hostile measures against the Salians, neither to waste or ravage _their own_ country, for he called every country _their own_ which was surrendered without resistance or toil on the part of the conquerors.Ó Mai, Script. Vez Nov. Collect. ii. 256, and Eunapius in Niebuhr, Byzant. Hist.]
